Package projetofinalpoo

Class CISUC

java.lang.Object
projetofinalpoo.CISUC
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class CISUC
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
A CISUC class represents an institution that contains research groups, researchers and publications. A CISUC is defined by an researchGroupList, researcherList and a publicationsList.

A researchGroupList represents all the main research groups that a CISUC is composed of. It is occupied solely with ResearchGroup objects.

A researcherList represents all the researchers in a CISUC, independent of their research group. It is occupied with

  • Students objects
  • EffectiveMember objects

A publicationsList represents all the publications made. It is occupied with
  • Book objects
  • BookChapeter objects
  • ConferenceArticleBook objects
  • ConferenceArticle objects
  • MagazineArticle objects

The main objective of a CISUC object is to connect Researchers, ResearchGroup and Publication objects in one object, simplifying code and saving execution time. A CISUC object can do the following operations:
  • return the researcherList, publicationList or researchGroupList;
  • add a Researcher to the researcherList;
  • add a ResearchGroup to the researchGroupList;
  • add a Publication to the publicationList;
  • find the responsible Researcher of a Student;
  • find a specific Researcher;
  • find a specific ResearchGroup;
  • show general information of the CISUC object;
  • show all the ResearchGroup in the researchGroupList on the console;
  • show all the Researcher in the researcherList on the console;
  • show the number of ResearcherGroup objects, in the researhGroupList, grouped by types on the console;
  • show the number of of Researcher objects, in the researcherList, grouped by types on the console;
  • return all the publications of a specific ResearchGroup;
  • return all the publications of a specific Researcher;
  • show all the publications of a specific publicationList (doesn't need to the publicationList of the CISUC object), ordered by year of publication, type of publication and impact factor
  • return a list with only the Publication objects of the last 5 years, from a specific date.
  • show information on the console about all the ResearchGroup objects

A CISUC is serializable, meaning that it can be saved in an object file.
See Also:
Publication, Researcher, ResearchGroup, Serialized Form

    • findResponsibleResearcher

      public Researcher findResponsibleResearcher​(java.lang.String name, ResearchGroup resGroup)
      This method receives as parameter a name of a Researcher and a ResearchGroup. The method looks in the researcherList for a Researcher with a matching name as the given one and, if found, it sees if the Researcher found is in the same ResearchGroup. If there is any Researcher that meets these 2 criteria, then that Researcher is returned. If there is no matching Researcher the method return null to indicate nothing has been found.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the Researcher to search for
      resGroup - ResearchGroup that checks, when a Researcher with the same name as the one given is found, if that Researcher is in the correct ResearchGroup
      Returns:
      a Researcher if one that fits the criteria is found or null when no Researcher fits the criteria
      See Also:
      Researcher

    • findResearchGroup

      public ResearchGroup findResearchGroup​(java.lang.String name)
      This method receives as parameter a name of a ResearchGroup. The method looks in the researchGroupList for a ResearcherGroup with a matching name as the given one and, if found, it returns the ResearchGroup. If there is no ResearchGroup that meets this criteria the method returns null to indicate nothing has been found.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the ResearchGroup to search for
      Returns:
      a ResearchGroup if one that fits the criteria is found or null when no ResearchGroup fits the criteria
      See Also:
      ResearchGroup

    • findResearcher

      public Researcher findResearcher​(java.lang.String name)
      This method receives as parameter a name of a Researcher. The method looks in the researcherGroupList for a Researcher with a matching name as the given one and, if found, it returns the Researcher. If there is no Researcher that meets this criteria the method returns null to indicate nothing has been found.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the Researcher to search for
      Returns:
      a Researcher if one that fits the criteria is found or null when no Researcher fits the criteria
      See Also:
      Researcher

    • showCISUCInformation

      public void showCISUCInformation()
      This method shows the basic information of this CISUC object. It shows, on the console, the number of Researchers that are in the researchersList, the number of researchers by category (EffectiveMembers and Students), the number of publications released in the last 5 years and the number of publications by category (Book, ConferenceArticleBook, BookChapter, ConferenceArticle, MagazineArticle).

    • showAllResearchGroups

      public void showAllResearchGroups()
      This method shows on the console all the ResearchGroup objects there are in this CISUC. It is shown on the console in the following format :

      ResearchGroup 1 | ResearchGroup 2 | ... | ResearchGroup n-1 | ResearchGroup n , being n the amount of ResearchGroup objects in this CISUC

    • showAllResearchers

      public void showAllResearchers()
      This method shows on the console all the Researcher objects there are in this CISUC. Due to there, possibly, being a lot of Researcher objects in a CISUC, every 8 Researcher objects a new line is inserted, so that there isn't just 1 line that extends a long distance, making it harder to find the information that we want. It is shown on the console i the following format:

      Researcher 1| Researcher 2| ... | Researcher 7 | Researcher 8

      Researcher 9| Researcher 10| ... | Researcher 15 | Researcher 16

      ... | Researcher n

      ,assuming that this CISUC has more than 16 researcher (not needed).

    • getPublicationsResearchGroup

      public java.util.List<Publication> getPublicationsResearchGroup​(ResearchGroup resGroup)
      This method returns a List of Publications from a ResearchGroup given as parameter. The goes through all the publications in the publicationList of the CISUC and looks for authors whose ResearchGroup is the same as the ResearchGroup given as parameter. If there is a match the publication is added to the publicationList and skips to the next publication, if there is no match it goes to the next publication to repeat the cycle, until there are no more publication in the publicationList.
      Parameters:
      resGroup - ResearchGroup we want to find publications from
      Returns:
      a List of Publication objects that are the publications of the given as parameter ResearchGroup

    • getPublicationsResearcher

      public java.util.List<Publication> getPublicationsResearcher​(Researcher res)
      This method returns a list with all the publications of a researcher. The method goes through all the publications in the CISUC and the author of a publication contains a specif Researcher (given as parameter) it adds that Publication to the final publicationList.
      Parameters:
      res - Researcher whose publications we want
      Returns:
      a Publication objects List, that represent the publications of the Researcher given as parameter

    • readPublicationList

      public void readPublicationList​(java.util.List<Publication> publicationsList)
      This method shows on the console all the publications in a given Publication objects List, ordered by publication year (decreasing order), type of publication and impact factor. The console message is in the following format:

      (Note this is just an example)

      ----- Publications list -----

      --- Year n ---

      | | Type of publication

      Factor A:

      - Publication 1;

      Factor C:

      - Publication 32;

      --- Year y ---

      (...)

      ,assuming that y is less then n and that we only have 1 publication with factor A and 1 publication with factor C in year n.

      The method uses the function compareTo from the Publication object to order the publicationList in a decreasing order. After having the initial list ordered, the method sees if it is in the right folder (a folder the area covered by a specific year, publication type and impact factor). If it is in the right folder we can just write another element in that folder, if it is not then the method creates a new folder/s, depending on which element is different (if the year is different then it creates a new year, type of publication and factor impact folder; if the type of publication is different but the year is the same the method creates a new type of publication folder and a new impact factor folder; if only the impact factor is different, then the method creates only a new impact factor folder). To write a Publication, the method uses the .toString() method of the Publication object. After it has written all of the publication on the console, the method signalizes the end by printing on the console 29 times "-".

      Parameters:
      publicationsList - list with the Publication objects that will be shown on the console
      See Also:
      Publication

    • publicationsOfTheLast5Years

      public java.util.List<Publication> publicationsOfTheLast5Years​(java.util.List<Publication> publicationList, int currentYear)
      This method receives a Publication objects List and return a Publication objects List that has the Publications of the list as parameter which year of publication is only, at maximum, 5 years apart from a given date (given as parameter). This goes through all the Publication objects and looks if the subtraction of the given year and the objects publication year is at maximum 5. If it is, add the object to the final Publications List, if not, ignores the object and goes to the next object.
      Parameters:
      publicationList - list of Publication objects to look for objects that fit the criteria above described
      currentYear - year from which the publications can differ 5 years from
      Returns:
      a List of Publication objects that differ, at maximum, 5 years from the input year

    • showResearchGroupsInformation

      public void showResearchGroupsInformation()
      This method shows information about all of the ResearchGroups on at a time. It shows on the console:
      • the number of researchers in the ResearchGroup;
      • the number of researcher by type in the ResearchGroup;
      • the number of publication in the last 5 years;
      • the number of publications in the last 5 years, ordered by year, type of publication and factor of impact.
      The last feature will show on the console in the following format (example):

      ----- Number of Publications by Year -----

      --- 2020 ---

      || Book

      Factor A:

      -2

      Factor C:

      -1

      --- 2019 ---

      (...)

      ,assuming that 2020 has 3 Book objects of which 2 are of factor A and 1 is of factor C.

      This method will show all of the features above for all of the ResearchGroups in the researchGroupList in the CISUC object.
